FuncDef:
The nat ip-address command configures an IP address for inter-chassis traffic diversion.
The undo nat ip-address command deletes an IP address for inter-chassis traffic diversion.
By default, no IP address is configured for distributing traffic to the master and slave chassis.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IP address for distributing traffic to the master and slave chassis.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the mask length of the IP address.
The value is an integer ranging from 16 to 32.

Specifies the name of a VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. In addition, the VPN instance name must not be _public_. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When NAT load balancing and dual-device hot backup are both configured, you can use either of the following methods to ensure that upstream traffic is sent to the master NAT device:
Configure policy-based routing redirection on the downstream device to which the master NAT device is connected.Configure the master NAT device to advertise a default route to its connected downstream device, and run the nat ip-address command to configure an IP address for inter-chassis traffic diversion as the next hop address of the default route.
After the nat ip-address command is run, the priority of the route to the configured NAT IP address on the master device is higher than that on the backup device.

Precautions
This command is applicable only to the VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
